name: config-reference-userconfig.ini
description: The file etc/userconfig.ini contains only configuration sections and parameter names, with no hardcoded credentials or sensitive information found. The file may serve as a template or configuration reference, with actual values stored elsewhere.

name: config-template-mdbcfg.ini
description: The file etc/mdbcfg.ini is an ASCII text file containing 10 attribute fields (attr0-attr9) with empty values. No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were identified.
notes: This file may be a configuration template or placeholder file, and sensitive information might be populated during actual use. It is recommended to verify whether these properties are dynamically assigned during runtime.

name: binary-analysis-camsvr
description: The camsvr binary contains some configuration parameters and debugging information, but no explicitly hardcoded credentials (such as passwords, API keys, etc.) were found.
notes: Although no sensitive information was found, it is recommended to check whether configuration parameters in the binary file could potentially be misused.

name: config-analysis-xver.ini
description: The xver.ini configuration file does not contain sensitive information, only basic video/audio configuration parameters.

name: crypto-potential_base64_key
notes: Possible custom Base64 encoding scheme, actual usage needs verification.

name: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
notes: Check the contents of the /mydlink/tdb file

name: network-hardcoded_mydlink_urls
description: Hard-coded mydlink service URLs (such as www.mydlink.com) were discovered, which are used for device connections to cloud services.

name: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
notes: The Base64 string 'YWRtaW46' decodes to 'REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER:'. It is recommended to inspect all systems using this authentication and update the credentials.

name: scan_limitation-var_directory
description: Under strict security restrictions, a comprehensive sensitive information scan of the var directory cannot be completed. All attempted commands failed due to security limitations. It is recommended to re-execute the scan in a more permissive environment or manually inspect critical files.
